RUS101.name: Elementary Russian I
RUS101.description: Russian language and culture. Development of skills in speaking, reading, listening, and writing.

RUS102.name: Elementary Russian II
RUS102.description: Further work on Russian language and culture. Further development of skills in speaking, reading, listening comprehension, and writing.

RUS151.name: Russian Language Review
RUS151.description: Reviews and enhances the content of Russian 101 and 102 and broadens students’ knowledge of Russian culture.

RUS201.name: Second-Year Russian I
RUS201.description: Intermediate-level development of Russian communication skills. Presentation and discussion of original oral and written texts on aspects of Russian life and culture.

RUS202.name: Second-Year Russian II
RUS202.description: Further intermediate-level development of Russian communication skills. Further presentation and discussion of original oral and written texts on aspects of Russian life and culture.

RUS231.name: 19th-Century Russian Literature in Translation
RUS231.description: Writings of authors such as Pushkin, Lermontov, Gogol, Turgenev, Dostoevsky,and Tolstoy as they examine important ethical questions and reflect social and political concerns.

RUS232.name: 20th-Century Russian Literature in Translation
RUS232.description: Writings of Chekhov, Bulgakov, Pasternak, Solzhenitsyn and Petrushevskaya as they examine the individual’s search for identity in twentieth-century Russian society.

RUS250.name: Russian and Soviet Cinema
RUS250.description: Development of Russian and Soviet cinematic styles and traditions in their historical and social contexts. Major films and directors. Introduction to film technique and analysis. Taught in English.

RUS290.name: Independent Study
RUS290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RUS290.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

RUS311.name: Advanced Russian: Oral Communication
RUS311.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RUS311.description: Development of listening comprehension and oral communication in Russian. Expansion of vocabulary, development of fluency, and use of idiomatic expressions. Review of grammatical structures relevant for speaking.

RUS341.name: Russian Life and Culture of the 20th Century
RUS341.description: Social, political, intellectual, and artistic life of twentieth-century Russia. Texts read in Russian.

RUS420.name: Russian Life and Culture Before World War I
RUS420.description: Advanced Russian language course. Social and cultural developments in Russia before 1914, using primary documents and films. Themes include Russian folk belief, life under the Tsars, the place of minorities in the Russian empire, and gender issues in Russia.

RUS421.name: Russian Life and Culture in the 20th Century
RUS421.description: Advanced Russian language course. Social and cultural developments in Russia and the Soviet Union between 1914 and 1991, using primary documents, television shows, and films. Themes include the revolutions of 1917, the rise of Stalin, the Cold War, the place of minorities in the Soviet Union, and the break-up of the Soviet Union.

RUS440.name: Contemporary Russian Life and Culture (W)
RUS440.description: Advanced Russian language course. Social and cultural developments in Russia since the break-up of the Soviet Union. Significant internet component. Themes include Russian life today, organized crime and business, conflict in Chechnya, and Russian attitudes toward the United States.

RUS441.name: Russian Literature (W)
RUS441.description: Advanced Russian language course. Reading and discussion of key works of Russian literature. Frequent interpretive essays.

RUS490.name: Independent Study
RUS490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RUS490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

RUS491.name: Special Topics in Russian Studies
RUS491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RUS491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings, proposed by faculty on a group study basis.

RUS493.name: Overseas Internship
RUS493.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
RUS493.description: Study of Russian language, culture, and literature at an approved site in the Russia. Exposure to Russian life and current events. Interaction with the Russian people.
RUS493.restrictions: Not open to sophomores. Approval of department.

RUS499.name: Senior Thesis Research
RUS499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
RUS499.description: An individual research project supervised by a faculty member that demonstrates the student's ability to do independent research and submit or present a major paper.
